Legislations.EnglishText: all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The Notice must also be signed and dated by one of the following designated persons before it is delivered to the person directed by the inspector to take the necessary measures: the Director, Compliance and Response, the Chief, Response Operations, or the Chief, Enforcement, of the Transport Dangerous Goods Directorate, Department of Transport.
Legislations.EnglishText: The Notice must also be signed and dated by one of the following designated persons before it is delivered to the person directed by the inspector to take the necessary measures: the Director, Compliance and Response, the Chief, Response Operations, or the Chief, Enforcement, of the Transport Dangerous Goods Directorate, Department of Transport.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The inspector must sign and date the Notice.
Legislations.EnglishText: The inspector must sign and date the Notice.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When an inspector directs a person, under subsection 17(3) of the Act, to take necessary measures to remedy non-compliance with the Act and these Regulations, the inspector must deliver to that person a Notice of Direction to Remedy Non-compliance in the form following this section.
Legislations.EnglishText: When an inspector directs a person, under subsection 17(3) of the Act, to take necessary measures to remedy non-compliance with the Act and these Regulations, the inspector must deliver to that person a Notice of Direction to Remedy Non-compliance in the form following this section.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The direction takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated in accordance with subsections (2) and (3). However, any non-compliance with the direction must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.
Legislations.EnglishText: The direction takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated in accordance with subsections (2) and (3). However, any non-compliance with the direction must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.

Legislations.EnglishText: in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, or referred to in paragraph 8.16(2)(a) or subparagraph 8.16(2)(b)(i) or (c)(i), a Natural Resources Canada inspector, at 613-995-5555; and

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_If there has been unlawful interference with dangerous goods while they were being imported, offered for transport, handled or transported, the person who had the charge, management or control of the goods must, as soon as possible after the discovery of the unlawful interference, report it by telephone to the persons listed in subsection (2).
Legislations.EnglishText: If there has been unlawful interference with dangerous goods while they were being imported, offered for transport, handled or transported, the person who had the charge, management or control of the goods must, as soon as possible after the discovery of the unlawful interference, report it by telephone to the persons listed in subsection (2).

FR_A consignor who allows a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport or who imports dangerous goods into Canada must, during a five-year period that begins on the date that appears on the shipping document, make a proof of classification available to the Minister on reasonable notice given by the Minister.
Legislations.EnglishText: A consignor who allows a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport or who imports dangerous goods into Canada must, during a five-year period that begins on the date that appears on the shipping document, make a proof of classification available to the Minister on reasonable notice given by the Minister.

FR_The manufacturer or subsequent distributor of a UN standardized small means of containment manufactured in Canada must provide a notice to the initial user in accordance with section 4.4 of TP 14850. The manufacturer or subsequent distributor of a UN standardized intermediate bulk container (IBC) manufactured in Canada must provide a notice to the initial user in accordance with clause 4.8 of CGSB-43.146.
Legislations.EnglishText: The manufacturer or subsequent distributor of a UN standardized small means of containment manufactured in Canada must provide a notice to the initial user in accordance with section 4.4 of TP 14850. The manufacturer or subsequent distributor of a UN standardized intermediate bulk container (IBC) manufactured in Canada must provide a notice to the initial user in accordance with clause 4.8 of CGSB-43.146.

Legislations.EnglishText: A person must not reuse a steel or plastic drum with a capacity greater than or equal to 150 L to handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods that are liquid and are included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 unless

Legislations.EnglishText: for a plastic drum, the requirements for the reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair in Part III of CGSB-43.126 are complied with and the drum reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair facility is registered with Transport Canada in accordance with the requirements of Appendix A of CGSB-43.126.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A person must not offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 in a small means of containment unless it is a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with Part II of CGSB-43.146 or a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with sections 2 and 3 and with Part 2 of TP 14850.
Legislations.EnglishText: A person must not offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 in a small means of containment unless it is a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with Part II of CGSB-43.146 or a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with sections 2 and 3 and with Part 2 of TP 14850.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_In addition to the requirements set out in subsection (1), a person who uses a means of containment that is required under CGSB-43.146 for the offering for transport of dangerous goods must follow the requirements of clauses 12.2, 12.3 and 12.4 of CGSB-43.146.
Legislations.EnglishText: In addition to the requirements set out in subsection (1), a person who uses a means of containment that is required under CGSB-43.146 for the offering for transport of dangerous goods must follow the requirements of clauses 12.2, 12.3 and 12.4 of CGSB-43.146.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A person must not reuse an IBC for liquids, or an IBC for solids, that is filled or discharged under pressure to offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods that are included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 unless it has been leak tested and inspected in accordance with clause 12.6 of CGSB-43.146.
Legislations.EnglishText: A person must not reuse an IBC for liquids, or an IBC for solids, that is filled or discharged under pressure to offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods that are included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 unless it has been leak tested and inspected in accordance with clause 12.6 of CGSB-43.146.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, are contained in a combination of tubes that are a single unit as a result of being interconnected through a piping arrangement and are permanently mounted on a structural frame for transport, the combination of tubes may be placarded as if it were one large means of containment.
Legislations.EnglishText: When dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, are contained in a combination of tubes that are a single unit as a result of being interconnected through a piping arrangement and are permanently mounted on a structural frame for transport, the combination of tubes may be placarded as if it were one large means of containment.

FR_The primary class placard for each of the dangerous goods contained in a large means of containment, other than a vessel or an aircraft, must be displayed on each side and on each end of the large means of containment.
Legislations.EnglishText: The primary class placard for each of the dangerous goods contained in a large means of containment, other than a vessel or an aircraft, must be displayed on each side and on each end of the large means of containment.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_If two or more dangerous goods have different UN numbers but are identified by the same placard or placards, the placard or placards are required to be displayed only once on each side and on each end of a large means of containment.
Legislations.EnglishText: If two or more dangerous goods have different UN numbers but are identified by the same placard or placards, the placard or placards are required to be displayed only once on each side and on each end of a large means of containment.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_obtain the LC50 of the mixture by dividing 1 by the number T (LC50 of the mixture = 1 / T).
Legislations.EnglishText: obtain the LC50 of the mixture by dividing 1 by the number T (LC50 of the mixture = 1 / T).

Legislations.EnglishText: combine the contributing numbers (CN) of each gas with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit using the formula

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_if the mixture contains only one gas with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Gas A”), use the following calculation:

Legislations.EnglishText: [Repealed, SOR/2008-34, s. 101]

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_To determine the LC50 of a mixture of substances that are in the form of a dust, mist or vapour, when the LC50 of each of the substances is known, make the determination in accordance with section 2.17, except that for a dust use 10 mg/L as the toxic limit and for a mist use 2 mg/L as the toxic limit. For a substance in the form of vapour the toxic limit is the same as for a gas, which is 5 000 mL/m3.
Legislations.EnglishText: To determine the LC50 of a mixture of substances that are in the form of a dust, mist or vapour, when the LC50 of each of the substances is known, make the determination in accordance with section 2.17, except that for a dust use 10 mg/L as the toxic limit and for a mist use 2 mg/L as the toxic limit. For a substance in the form of vapour the toxic limit is the same as for a gas, which is 5 000 mL/m3.

FR_The inspector must sign and date the Notice.
Legislations.EnglishText: The inspector must sign and date the Notice.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A person may request a review of the detention at any time after it takes effect and the Notice is delivered to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or of the means of containment. The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:
Legislations.EnglishText: A person may request a review of the detention at any time after it takes effect and the Notice is delivered to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or of the means of containment. The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:

Legislations.Label: 16.3 (5) (c)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the reasons why the detention should be revoked; and
Legislations.EnglishText: the reasons why the detention should be revoked; and

Legislations.Label: 16.3 (5) (d)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.
Legislations.EnglishText: all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.

Legislations.Label: 16.3 (5) (a)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;
Legislations.EnglishText: the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;

Legislations.Label: 16.3 (5) (b)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_a copy of the Notice;
Legislations.EnglishText: a copy of the Notice;

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The detention takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated by the inspector. However, any non-compliance with the detention must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.
Legislations.EnglishText: The detention takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated by the inspector. However, any non-compliance with the detention must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The detention expires 12 months after the day on which it takes effect, but it may be revoked earlier, in writing, by an inspector.
Legislations.EnglishText: The detention expires 12 months after the day on which it takes effect, but it may be revoked earlier, in writing, by an inspector.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When an inspector detains dangerous goods or a means of containment under subsection 17(1) or (2) of the Act, the inspector must deliver a Detention Notice in the form following this section to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or of the means of containment at the time they are detained.
Legislations.EnglishText: When an inspector detains dangerous goods or a means of containment under subsection 17(1) or (2) of the Act, the inspector must deliver a Detention Notice in the form following this section to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or of the means of containment at the time they are detained.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The Minister or the Director General must notify the person, in writing, of the decision made and the reasons for the decision.
Legislations.EnglishText: The Minister or the Director General must notify the person, in writing, of the decision made and the reasons for the decision.

FR_When a consignment of dangerous goods is transported from a place outside Canada to a place in Canada and is reshipped within Canada by railway vehicle, the dangerous goods safety marks displayed in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code at the time of entry into Canada may continue to be displayed, except that the large means of containment containing the dangerous goods must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
Legislations.EnglishText: When a consignment of dangerous goods is transported from a place outside Canada to a place in Canada and is reshipped within Canada by railway vehicle, the dangerous goods safety marks displayed in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code at the time of entry into Canada may continue to be displayed, except that the large means of containment containing the dangerous goods must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The shipping document that accompanies the dangerous goods must include a notation that the dangerous goods safety marks are in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code, if they differ from the ones required to be displayed by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
Legislations.EnglishText: The shipping document that accompanies the dangerous goods must include a notation that the dangerous goods safety marks are in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code, if they differ from the ones required to be displayed by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

FR_Subject to subsection (3), a person who is required by subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported at an aerodrome, at an air cargo facility or by aircraft must as soon as possible after a release or anticipated release, make a report if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:
Legislations.EnglishText: Subject to subsection (3), a person who is required by subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported at an aerodrome, at an air cargo facility or by aircraft must as soon as possible after a release or anticipated release, make a report if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The report referred to in subsection (1) must be made to CANUTEC, at 1-888-CANUTEC (1-888-226-8832) or 613-996-6666, and, in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, to the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission.
Legislations.EnglishText: The report referred to in subsection (1) must be made to CANUTEC, at 1-888-CANUTEC (1-888-226-8832) or 613-996-6666, and, in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, to the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The person is not required to make the report referred to in subsection (1) if the release or anticipated release does not result in any of the following:
Legislations.EnglishText: The person is not required to make the report referred to in subsection (1) if the release or anticipated release does not result in any of the following:

Legislations.Label: 8.9 (3) (d)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_serious jeopardy to persons on an aircraft or to the aircraft itself;
Legislations.EnglishText: serious jeopardy to persons on an aircraft or to the aircraft itself;

FR_When a large means of containment that has labels, placards, labels and UN numbers, or placards and UN numbers, displayed on it is loaded onto another large means of containment and those labels, placards, labels and UN numbers, or placards and UN numbers, are visible, the placards, or placards and UN numbers, are not required to be displayed on the other large means of containment.
Legislations.EnglishText: When a large means of containment that has labels, placards, labels and UN numbers, or placards and UN numbers, displayed on it is loaded onto another large means of containment and those labels, placards, labels and UN numbers, or placards and UN numbers, are visible, the placards, or placards and UN numbers, are not required to be displayed on the other large means of containment.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When a large means of containment that has labels or placards displayed on it is inside another large means of containment and those labels or placards are not visible, the placards required by this Part must be displayed on the outer large means of containment. The UN numbers that are required by this Part must also be displayed on the outer large means of containment.
Legislations.EnglishText: When a large means of containment that has labels or placards displayed on it is inside another large means of containment and those labels or placards are not visible, the placards required by this Part must be displayed on the outer large means of containment. The UN numbers that are required by this Part must also be displayed on the outer large means of containment.

FR_A person who has made a follow-up report referred to in section 8.11 must, as soon as possible, notify the Minister of any change to the information referred to in paragraph 8.12(e), (h), (i), (k), (n) or (q) that occurs within one year after the day on which the follow-up report was made.
Legislations.EnglishText: A person who has made a follow-up report referred to in section 8.11 must, as soon as possible, notify the Minister of any change to the information referred to in paragraph 8.12(e), (h), (i), (k), (n) or (q) that occurs within one year after the day on which the follow-up report was made.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The person must make the report available to an inspector within 15 days after the day on which the person receives a written request from the inspector.
Legislations.EnglishText: The person must make the report available to an inspector within 15 days after the day on which the person receives a written request from the inspector.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The person must keep a copy of the report for two years after the day on which it is made.
Legislations.EnglishText: The person must keep a copy of the report for two years after the day on which it is made.

Legislations.EnglishText: Keeping Proof of Training: Employer’s and Self-Employed Person’s Responsibility

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A person who is required by subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel must, as soon as possible after a release or anticipated release, make an emergency report to any local authority that is responsible for responding to emergencies at the geographic location of the release or anticipated release if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:
Legislations.EnglishText: A person who is required by subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel must, as soon as possible after a release or anticipated release, make an emergency report to any local authority that is responsible for responding to emergencies at the geographic location of the release or anticipated release if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Class 2, Gases, or Ammonia Solutions (Class 8) in Refrigerating Machines Exemption
Legislations.EnglishText: Class 2, Gases, or Ammonia Solutions (Class 8) in Refrigerating Machines Exemption

FR_[Repealed, SOR/2008-34, s. 40]
Legislations.EnglishText: [Repealed, SOR/2008-34, s. 40]

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport must be accompanied by a shipping document that, despite subsections (1) and (5) and section 3.6, includes the following information if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment:
Legislations.EnglishText: A means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport must be accompanied by a shipping document that, despite subsections (1) and (5) and section 3.6, includes the following information if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment:

Legislations.Label: 3.5 (3) (b)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the class, Class 9;
Legislations.EnglishText: the class, Class 9;

Legislations.Label: 3.5 (3) (c)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the UN number, UN3359;
Legislations.EnglishText: the UN number, UN3359;

Legislations.Label: 3.5 (3) (e)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the date of fumigation; and
Legislations.EnglishText: the date of fumigation; and

Legislations.Label: 3.5 (3) (d)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the quantity of the fumigant;
Legislations.EnglishText: the quantity of the fumigant;

Legislations.Label: 3.5 (3) (f)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_instructions for the disposal of residues of the fumigant or fumigation device.
Legislations.EnglishText: instructions for the disposal of residues of the fumigant or fumigation device.

Legislations.Label: 3.5 (3) (a)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the shipping name, “FUMIGATED UNIT” or “ENGIN SOUS FUMIGATION”;
Legislations.EnglishText: the shipping name, “FUMIGATED UNIT” or “ENGIN SOUS FUMIGATION”;

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_If the quantity of dangerous goods required on a shipping document under paragraph (1)(d) or the number of small means of containment required under paragraph (1)(e) changes during transport, the carrier must show those changes on the shipping document or on a document attached to the shipping document.
Legislations.EnglishText: If the quantity of dangerous goods required on a shipping document under paragraph (1)(d) or the number of small means of containment required under paragraph (1)(e) changes during transport, the carrier must show those changes on the shipping document or on a document attached to the shipping document.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The telephone number of a person who is not the consignor, such as CANUTEC, but who is competent to give the technical information required by paragraph (1)(f) in English or in French may be used. However, to use CANUTEC’s telephone number, the consignor must receive permission, in writing, from CANUTEC. A consignor who uses the telephone number of an organization or agency other than CANUTEC must ensure that the organization or agency has current, accurate information on the dangerous goods the consignor offers for transport and, if the organization or agency is located outside Canada, the telephone number must include the country code and, if required, the city code.
Legislations.EnglishText: The telephone number of a person who is not the consignor, such as CANUTEC, but who is competent to give the technical information required by paragraph (1)(f) in English or in French may be used. However, to use CANUTEC’s telephone number, the consignor must receive permission, in writing, from CANUTEC. A consignor who uses the telephone number of an organization or agency other than CANUTEC must ensure that the organization or agency has current, accurate information on the dangerous goods the consignor offers for transport and, if the organization or agency is located outside Canada, the telephone number must include the country code and, if required, the city code.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Despite paragraph (1)(d), if the means of containment contains a residue, the words “Residue – Last Contained” or “Résidu – dernier contenu” may be added before or after the description of the dangerous goods. These words must not, however, be used for dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, that are in a small means of containment or for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials.
Legislations.EnglishText: Despite paragraph (1)(d), if the means of containment contains a residue, the words “Residue – Last Contained” or “Résidu – dernier contenu” may be added before or after the description of the dangerous goods. These words must not, however, be used for dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, that are in a small means of containment or for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The following information must be included on a shipping document:
Legislations.EnglishText: The following information must be included on a shipping document:

Legislations.Label: 3.5 (1) (f)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the words “24-Hour Number” or “Numéro 24 heures”, or an abbreviation of these words, followed by a telephone number, including the area code, at which the consignor can be reached immediately for technical information about the dangerous goods in transport, without breaking the telephone connection made by the caller.
Legislations.EnglishText: the words “24-Hour Number” or “Numéro 24 heures”, or an abbreviation of these words, followed by a telephone number, including the area code, at which the consignor can be reached immediately for technical information about the dangerous goods in transport, without breaking the telephone connection made by the caller.

FR_Beginning on July 15, 2015, a shipping document must include, after the information required under section 3.5, one of the following certifications:
Legislations.EnglishText: Beginning on July 15, 2015, a shipping document must include, after the information required under section 3.5, one of the following certifications:

Legislations.Label: 3.6.1 (1) (e)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the certification set out in section 5.4.1.6 of the UN Recommendations.
Legislations.EnglishText: the certification set out in section 5.4.1.6 of the UN Recommendations.

Legislations.Label: 3.6.1 (1) (b)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the certification set out in section 172.204 of 49 CFR;
Legislations.EnglishText: the certification set out in section 172.204 of 49 CFR;

Legislations.Label: 3.6.1 (1) (c)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the certification set out in section 5;4.1.6 of the ICAO Technical Instructions;
Legislations.EnglishText: the certification set out in section 5;4.1.6 of the ICAO Technical Instructions;

Legislations.Label: 3.6.1 (1) (d)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the certification set out in section 5.4.1.6 of the IMDG Code; or
Legislations.EnglishText: the certification set out in section 5.4.1.6 of the IMDG Code; or

Legislations.Label: 3.6.1 (1) (a)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_“I hereby declare that the contents of this consignment are fully and accurately described above by the proper shipping name, are properly classified and packaged, have dangerous goods safety marks properly affixed or displayed on them, and are in all respects in proper condition for transport according to the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations.”;
Legislations.EnglishText: “I hereby declare that the contents of this consignment are fully and accurately described above by the proper shipping name, are properly classified and packaged, have dangerous goods safety marks properly affixed or displayed on them, and are in all respects in proper condition for transport according to the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations.”;

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_This section does not apply in respect of a large means of containment that contains a residue.
Legislations.EnglishText: This section does not apply in respect of a large means of containment that contains a residue.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The certification must be made by an individual who is the consignor or by an individual acting on behalf of the consignor and must set out that individual’s name.
Legislations.EnglishText: The certification must be made by an individual who is the consignor or by an individual acting on behalf of the consignor and must set out that individual’s name.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Any substance that would require an ERAP if its classification were determined in accordance with Part 2 (Classification) requires an approved ERAP if its appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations is to be used under subsection 2.2(4).

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_On the day these Regulations come into force, the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations, as made by Order in Council P.C. 1985-147 dated January 17, 1985 and registered as SOR/85-77, are repealed.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_As provided for in section 40 of the Act, a person must not be found guilty of an offence if it is established that the person took all reasonable measures to comply with the Act or to prevent the commission of the offence.

FR_A document that is issued to a foreign member of the flight crew of an aircraft registered in a country that is a Member State of the International Civil Aviation Organization and that indicates that the crew member is trained to transport dangerous goods by air is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations, in accordance with Article 33 of the Convention on International Civil Aviation, when that document is valid in the Member State.
Legislations.EnglishText: A document that is issued to a foreign member of the flight crew of an aircraft registered in a country that is a Member State of the International Civil Aviation Organization and that indicates that the crew member is trained to transport dangerous goods by air is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations, in accordance with Article 33 of the Convention on International Civil Aviation, when that document is valid in the Member State.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A document that is issued to a foreign member of the crew of a vessel registered in a country that is a Member State of the International Maritime Organization and that indicates that the crew member is trained to transport dangerous goods by vessel is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when that document is valid in the Member State.
Legislations.EnglishText: A document that is issued to a foreign member of the crew of a vessel registered in a country that is a Member State of the International Maritime Organization and that indicates that the crew member is trained to transport dangerous goods by vessel is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when that document is valid in the Member State.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A document that is issued to a driver of a road vehicle licensed in the United States or to a member of the crew of a train subject to 49 CFR for the transportation of dangerous goods and that indicates that the driver or the crew member is trained in accordance with sections 172.700 to 172.704 of 49 CFR is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when that document is valid in the United States.
Legislations.EnglishText: A document that is issued to a driver of a road vehicle licensed in the United States or to a member of the crew of a train subject to 49 CFR for the transportation of dangerous goods and that indicates that the driver or the crew member is trained in accordance with sections 172.700 to 172.704 of 49 CFR is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when that document is valid in the United States.

FR_Infectious substances that are included in Category A and that are in a form other than a culture may be handled, offered for transport or transported as Category B in accordance with the conditions set out in paragraphs 1.39(a) to (c) of Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases).
Legislations.EnglishText: Infectious substances that are included in Category A and that are in a form other than a culture may be handled, offered for transport or transported as Category B in accordance with the conditions set out in paragraphs 1.39(a) to (c) of Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases).

FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of blood or blood components that are intended for transfusion or for the preparation of blood products and are reasonably believed not to contain infectious substances.
Legislations.EnglishText: Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of blood or blood components that are intended for transfusion or for the preparation of blood products and are reasonably believed not to contain infectious substances.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The blood or blood components referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the blood or blood components.
Legislations.EnglishText: The blood or blood components referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the blood or blood components.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_These Regulations come into force 12 months after the day on which they are published in Part II of the Canada Gazette.
Legislations.EnglishText: These Regulations come into force 12 months after the day on which they are published in Part II of the Canada Gazette.

FR_The master of a vessel containing dangerous goods or the master in control of a vessel containing dangerous goods must have readily available on or near the bridge of the vessel a paper copy or electronic copy of
Legislations.EnglishText: The master of a vessel containing dangerous goods or the master in control of a vessel containing dangerous goods must have readily available on or near the bridge of the vessel a paper copy or electronic copy of

Legislations.Label: 3.9 (1) (a)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the shipping document; or
Legislations.EnglishText: the shipping document; or

Legislations.Label: 3.9 (1) (b)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_a list that includes the classification of the dangerous goods.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_If dangerous goods are transported by vessel on board a road vehicle that is accompanied by one or more drivers or a railway vehicle that is accompanied by one or more members of the train crew, a driver or a member of the train crew must notify the master of the vessel or the marine carrier of the presence of the dangerous goods and make available to the master a copy of the shipping document. However, the shipping document must be kept, for the road vehicle, in accordance with section 3.7 and, for the railway vehicle, in the possession of a member of the train crew.
Legislations.EnglishText: If dangerous goods are transported by vessel on board a road vehicle that is accompanied by one or more drivers or a railway vehicle that is accompanied by one or more members of the train crew, a driver or a member of the train crew must notify the master of the vessel or the marine carrier of the presence of the dangerous goods and make available to the master a copy of the shipping document. However, the shipping document must be kept, for the road vehicle, in accordance with section 3.7 and, for the railway vehicle, in the possession of a member of the train crew.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When an inspector directs, under subsection 17(4) of the Act, a person who has charge, management or control of dangerous goods or means of containment that the dangerous goods or means of containment not be imported into Canada or, if they are already in Canada, that they be returned to their place of origin, the inspector must deliver to that person a Notice of Direction Not to Import or to Return to Place of Origin in the form following this section.
Legislations.EnglishText: When an inspector directs, under subsection 17(4) of the Act, a person who has charge, management or control of dangerous goods or means of containment that the dangerous goods or means of containment not be imported into Canada or, if they are already in Canada, that they be returned to their place of origin, the inspector must deliver to that person a Notice of Direction Not to Import or to Return to Place of Origin in the form following this section.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The inspector must sign and date the Notice.
Legislations.EnglishText: The inspector must sign and date the Notice.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The direction takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated by the inspector. However, any non-compliance with the direction must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.
Legislations.EnglishText: The direction takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated by the inspector. However, any non-compliance with the direction must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A person may request a review of the direction at any time after it takes effect and the Notice is delivered to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or means of containment. Legislations.EnglishText: A carrier must be able to immediately provide to CANUTEC a copy of a consist whenever the train to which the consist applies is in operation or is involved in an accident.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_The consist must include, for each railway vehicle containing dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks),
Legislations.EnglishText: The consist must include, for each railway vehicle containing dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks),

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When a train includes a railway vehicle containing dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), the person in charge of the train must prepare and give a consist to a member of the train crew. The information on the consist must be kept up to date by the train crew and kept with the shipping document.

The information on the consist must be kept up to date by the train crew and kept with the shipping document.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_

FR_A person who handles or transports dangerous goods by railway vehicle in accordance with an exemption issued under Subpart B of Part 107 of 49 CFR may do so from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada if the exemption number appears on the shipping document.
Legislations.EnglishText: A person who handles or transports dangerous goods by railway vehicle in accordance with an exemption issued under Subpart B of Part 107 of 49 CFR may do so from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada if the exemption number appears on the shipping document.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by railway vehicle from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of 49 CFR if
Legislations.EnglishText: Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by railway vehicle from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of 49 CFR if

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When dangerous goods in transport are left in a supervised area, the person in charge of the supervised area is considered to have taken possession of the dangerous goods. Legislations.FrenchText: FR_If a substance is known to be included in Class 8, Corrosives, and that knowledge is based on documentary evidence published in technical journals or government publications and testing is not done to determine the packing group, the substance must be included in Packing Group I.
Legislations.EnglishText: If a substance is known to be included in Class 8, Corrosives, and that knowledge is based on documentary evidence published in technical journals or government publications and testing is not done to determine the packing group, the substance must be included in Packing Group I.

Legislations.Label: 2.42 (2) (a)

Legislations.Label: 2.42 (2) (b)

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_These Regulations do not apply to dangerous goods that are in quantities necessary to respond to an emergency that endangers public safety and that are in transport in a means of transport that is dedicated to emergency response, unless the dangerous goods are forbidden for transport in Schedule 1, Schedule 3 or, for transport by aircraft, the ICAO Technical Instructions.
Legislations.EnglishText: These Regulations do not apply to dangerous goods that are in quantities necessary to respond to an emergency that endangers public safety and that are in transport in a means of transport that is dedicated to emergency response, unless the dangerous goods are forbidden for transport in Schedule 1, Schedule 3 or, for transport by aircraft, the ICAO Technical Instructions.

Legislations.EnglishText: Miscellaneous Special Cases

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_

FR_The person who neutralizes the contents of the means of containment or who unloads, unpacks, cleans or purges the means of containment must cover or remove the dangerous goods safety mark when the danger indicated by the dangerous goods safety mark is no longer present in the means of containment.
Legislations.EnglishText: The person who neutralizes the contents of the means of containment or who unloads, unpacks, cleans or purges the means of containment must cover or remove the dangerous goods safety mark when the danger indicated by the dangerous goods safety mark is no longer present in the means of containment.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When the conditions that required the display of dangerous goods safety marks change, the person having the charge, management or control of the means of containment must determine, as a result of the new conditions, whether the dangerous goods safety marks must be changed or removed.
Legislations.EnglishText: When the conditions that required the display of dangerous goods safety marks change, the person having the charge, management or control of the means of containment must determine, as a result of the new conditions, whether the dangerous goods safety marks must be changed or removed.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When the DANGER placard is permitted to be displayed on a large means of containment, a person may continue to display that placard, in place of any other placard, until the large means of containment no longer contains any of the dangerous goods identified by that placard.
Legislations.EnglishText: When the DANGER placard is permitted to be displayed on a large means of containment, a person may continue to display that placard, in place of any other placard, until the large means of containment no longer contains any of the dangerous goods identified by that placard.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_General
Legislations.EnglishText: General

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Substances included in Class 9, Miscellaneous Products, Substances and Organisms, are included in Packing Group III unless they are included in a different packing group shown for them in column 4 of Schedule 1.
Legislations.EnglishText: Substances included in Class 9, Miscellaneous Products, Substances and Organisms, are included in Packing Group III unless they are included in a different packing group shown for them in column 4 of Schedule 1.

Legislations.Label: PART 5
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Means of Containment
Legislations.EnglishText: Means of Containment

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_When a substance is regulated in the United States by 49 CFR but is not regulated in Canada by these Regulations, a person may transport the substance between Canada and the United States by road vehicle or railway vehicle in accordance with all or part of 49 CFR.
Legislations.EnglishText: When a substance is regulated in the United States by 49 CFR but is not regulated in Canada by these Regulations, a person may transport the substance between Canada and the United States by road vehicle or railway vehicle in accordance with all or part of 49 CFR.

Legislations.EnglishText: Before importing dangerous goods or allowing a carrier in Canada to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Despite section 5.10, a person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods that are UN1950, AEROSOLS, or UN2037, GAS CARTRIDGES, unless they are contained in a means of containment that is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CGSB-43.123.
Legislations.EnglishText: Despite section 5.10, a person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods that are UN1950, AEROSOLS, or UN2037, GAS CARTRIDGES, unless they are contained in a means of containment that is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CGSB-43.123.

Legislations.EnglishText: ERAP Reports

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_
FR_Substances that are liquids or liquids containing solids in solution or suspension are included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, if they
Legislations.EnglishText: Substances that are liquids or liquids containing solids in solution or suspension are included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, if they

Legislations.Label: 2.18 (1) (a)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_have a flash point less than or equal to 60ºC using the closed-cup test method referred to in Chapter 2.3 of the UN Recommendations; or
Legislations.EnglishText: have a flash point less than or equal to 60ºC using the closed-cup test method referred to in Chapter 2.3 of the UN Recommendations; or

Legislations.Label: 2.18 (1) (b)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_are intended or expected to be at a temperature that is greater than or equal to their flash point at any time while the substances are in transport.
Legislations.EnglishText: are intended or expected to be at a temperature that is greater than or equal to their flash point at any time while the substances are in transport.

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Despite paragraph (1)(a), liquids that have a flash point greater than 35°C are not included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, if they
Legislations.EnglishText: Despite paragraph (1)(a), liquids that have a flash point greater than 35°C are not included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, if they

Legislations.Label: 2.18 (2) (b)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_have a fire point greater than 100°C, as determined in accordance with ISO 2592; or
Legislations.EnglishText: have a fire point greater than 100°C, as determined in accordance with ISO 2592; or

Legislations.Label: 2.18 (2) (c)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_are water-miscible solutions with a water content greater than 90% by mass.
Legislations.EnglishText: are water-miscible solutions with a water content greater than 90% by mass.

Legislations.Label: 2.18 (2) (a)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_do not sustain combustion, as determined in accordance with the sustained combustibility test referred to in section 2.3.1.3 of Chapter 2.3 of the UN Recommendations;
Legislations.EnglishText: do not sustain combustion, as determined in accordance with the sustained combustibility test referred to in section 2.3.1.3 of Chapter 2.3 of the UN Recommendations;

Legislations.EnglishText: Explosives, Class 1.4S

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to substances that are classified as marine pollutants in accordance with section 2.43 of Part 2 (Classification) if they are in transport solely on land by road vehicle or railway vehicle. However, substances may be identified as marine pollutants on a shipping document and the required dangerous goods safety marks may be displayed when they are in transport by road or railway vehicle.
Legislations.EnglishText: Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to substances that are classified as marine pollutants in accordance with section 2.43 of Part 2 (Classification) if they are in transport solely on land by road vehicle or railway vehicle. However, substances may be identified as marine pollutants on a shipping document and the required dangerous goods safety marks may be displayed when they are in transport by road or railway vehicle.

Legislations.EnglishText: Direction to Remedy Non-compliance

Legislations.FrenchText: FR_A release or anticipated release report referred to in section 8.4 must include the following information:
Legislations.EnglishText: A release or anticipated release report referred to in section 8.4 must include the following information:

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (k)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_if applicable, an estimate of the number of people evacuated or sheltered in place; and
Legislations.EnglishText: if applicable, an estimate of the number of people evacuated or sheltered in place; and

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (g)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the quantity of dangerous goods estimated to have been released;
Legislations.EnglishText: in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the quantity of dangerous goods estimated to have been released;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (j)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;
Legislations.EnglishText: a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (i)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_if applicable, the name and geographic location of any road, main railway line or main waterway that was closed;
Legislations.EnglishText: if applicable, the name and geographic location of any road, main railway line or main waterway that was closed;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (b)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the release;
Legislations.EnglishText: in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the release;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (c)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;
Legislations.EnglishText: in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (e)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;
Legislations.EnglishText: the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (h)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_if applicable, the type of incident leading to the release or anticipated release, including a collision, rollover, derailment, overfill, fire, explosion or load-shift;
Legislations.EnglishText: if applicable, the type of incident leading to the release or anticipated release, including a collision, rollover, derailment, overfill, fire, explosion or load-shift;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (a)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the name and contact information of the person making the report;
Legislations.EnglishText: the name and contact information of the person making the report;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (l)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_if applicable, the number of deaths and the number of persons who sustained injuries that required immediate medical treatment by a health care provider.
Legislations.EnglishText: if applicable, the number of deaths and the number of persons who sustained injuries that required immediate medical treatment by a health care provider.

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (d)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the mode of transport used;
Legislations.EnglishText: the mode of transport used;

Legislations.Label: 8.5 (f)
Legislations.FrenchText: FR_the quantity of dangerous goods that was in the means of containment before the release or anticipated release;
Legislations.EnglishText: the quantity of dangerous goods that was in the means of containment before the release or anticipated release;
